item.title: Doing Data Science (Book)
item.author: your-email (jonthelaion)
item.description: Chapter 1 - Introduction: What Is Data Science? With many years of experience in both academia and industry, authors Cathy Oâ€™Neil & Rachel Schutt look beyond the hype to explore what the data science discipline looks like in practice. They also explore an idea that is often overlooked when speaking about data science - that building models and working with data is not value-neutral. You choose the problems you will work on, you make assumptions in those models, you choose metrics, and you design the algorithms.
